item.title: OSPO++ Teaching OpenSource
item.description: In this Community Call Heidi Ellis and Greg Hislop will talk about the educational opportunities provided by the TeachingOpenSource community.

item.title: Semesters of Code
item.description: Semesters of Code expanded to multiple institutions in the current academic year. In this session, we will hear an update on how Semesters of Code has evolved and opportunities for future engagement.

item.title: Open Source Security
item.description: During this event, we will give an overview of some of the latest discussions on Open Source Security in the ecosystem and discuss how academic institutions can respond.

item.title: Setting Up University OSPOS
item.description: This call will be particularly useful for universities or academic institutions seeking to build and support open source capacity

item.title: OSPO++ Skills Workshop
item.description: This workshop is a follow-up to the Sep 22nd OSPO++ Community Call on Skills and Education.

item.title: Open Source Education and Skills
item.description: During the call we will be answering questions such as: What are the skills the ecosystem needs?

item.title: OSPOS in Academic Institutions Workshop
item.description: Workshop for the first phase of the process to create a Guide for OSPOs in Academic Institutions.

item.title: US Open Source Policy
item.description: The Open Source Policy Roundtable The Policy Roundtable is a neutral, non-partisan, group of experts in different fields focused on working through the policy implications of Open Source in the US, hosted by the Institute of Applied Open Source at Johns Hopkins University.

item.title: Universities and Acandemia & Cities and Governments
item.description: As 2021 roles to a close, we invite all those in the OSPO ecosystem, that we have interacted with virtually, in-person or have yet to meet, to come together, stop by and share in the group discussion, announce & celebrate your and other’s FOSS wins together, have a breakout chat with a friend, and join us for a drink.

item.title: Universities & Academia
item.description: Measuring OSPOs, Measuring Open Source, Measuring Impact - Theory to Practice When: 9am PT, 12pm EDT, 6pm CET on Thursday November 11, 2021

item.title: When Institutions Cooperate
item.description: This special 2 hour OSPO++ Workshop happened live from Paris as part the in-person Paris Open Source Global Forum (Nov 8) and at the start of the Paris Open Source Experience (Nov 9 & 10).

item.title: Contact Us
item.description: The quickest and best way to reach us is to join Slack and ask your question in the #general channel.

item.title: OSPO++ Commons Code of Conduct
item.description: Our Pledge We as members, contributors, and leaders pledge to make participation in our community a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of age, body size, visible or invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity and expression, level of experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, or sexual identity and orientation.
